title: Jessica Rowe and Peter Overton land in Sydney after family trip to Hawaii
text:
Jessica Rowe and Peter Overton landed in Sydney Airport on Tuesday after a family holiday in Hawaii with their daughters Allegra, 12, and Giselle, 10.

The couple, who married in 2004, couldn't wipe the smiles off their faces as they strolled through the terminal before heading home.

All four were in high spirits, showing no sign of a post-holiday comedown.

Holiday of a lifetime! Jessica Rowe (right) and Peter Overton (left) landed in Sydney Airport on Tuesday after a family holiday in Hawaii with their daughters Allegra, 12, and Giselle, 10

Dressed in tracksuit pants, a comfortable T-shirt and leopard print scarf, the former Studio 10 host, 49, looked relaxed and well-rested.

She held one of their daughters' hands while Nine News anchor Peter, 53, walked ahead of them and pushed along their luggage.

In an interview with New Idea on Monday, Jessica revealed she feels happier and more confident than ever before.

Must have been a good flight! The couple, who married in 2004, couldn't wipe the smiles off their faces as they strolled through the terminal before heading home

What a gentleman! Jessica held one of their daughters' hands while Nine News anchor Peter, 53, walked ahead of them and pushed along their luggage

According to Jessica, she 'wasted' her twenties and thirties worrying about things and people that didn't really matter.

'I look back and I realise in my twenties and thirties I wasted far too much energy invested in what people thought of me and also wasting energy on people who - really, when I think about it - I didn't really like very much,' she confessed.

Jessica added that she has since learned to 'embrace' herself for who she really is.

'Now I'm 49 and I can say I'm the happiest I've ever been because I really embrace who I am, my sort of flaws, my vulnerabilities, my quirks, I realise that I'm not perfect,' she said.

Feels good to be home! Dressed in tracksuit pants, a comfortable T-shirt and leopard print scarf, the former Studio 10 host, 49, looked relaxed and well-rested

Back to reality! All four were in high spirits, showing no sign of a post-holiday comedown

'It is impossible to have the perfect life; it's impossible to be all things to everyone, and we have to let go of that myth of being Superwoman, that myth of being the perfect mum, the perfect wife, the perfect friend, the perfect career woman - there's no such thing.'

Jessica previously spoke about getting older in an interview with Whimn in September last year.

'What I love about getting older is that I know I have got quirkier and more eccentric, which is very freeing, because I care less about what people think, and that is so lovely,' she said.

'I'm the happiest I've ever been!' In an interview with New Idea on Monday, Jessica revealed she feels happier and more confident than ever before

Finally free: According to Jessica, she 'wasted' her twenties and thirties worrying about things and people that didn't really matter

Despite her newfound confidence, Jessica recently admitted she had a hard time being 'sexy' on The Real Dirty Dancing.

In an interview with The Morning Show last month, she confessed to feeling insecure going into the show.

'I found it very confronting, and I didn't expect that would happen... So for me to shed my inhibitions and shed my gear was hard,' she said.
description: Jessica Rowe and Peter Overton landed in Sydney Airport on Tuesday after a family holiday in Hawaii with their daughters Allegra, 12, and Giselle, 10.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
